Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] CopyIfChanged use last "write" time" (#1968) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1962

Since 0adf1ae0, I believe that resource changes on macOS have been
flaky--sometimes working, sometimes not. They have been consistenly
working on Windows, however...

After writing the simplest test I could, I found that my machine on
High Sierra could *sometimes* reproduce what our QA team was seeing. I
had to add the `[Repeat]` NUnit attribute before I could get the
failure to occur regularly.

After debugging for quite some time, I noticed a mistake in the
`CopyIfChanged` task. When comparing timestamps, it looks like it is
using the last *access* time of the destination file instead of the
last *write* time!

I think this is likely a typo (unintended), since switching the call
to `GetLastWriteTimeUtc` fixes the problem. Keeping the test is a good
idea, because it seems a bit scary we didn't catch this yet...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove local reference to a Java object when done with it" (#1967) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/627319

Network interface information retrieval code needs to call a number of Java
methods in order to obtain the information from the OS. A failure to free one of
the retrieved local references caused a leak and, in effect, DevDiv issue

Make sure to remove the refernce before returning to the caller.

Lumped together is a potential NULL dereference fix and an unnecessary signed
comparison of unsigned operands.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unable to get the path of an assembly with Xamarin.Android in release" (#1966) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Generate a new Xamarin.Android Project 
2.  Compile and execute the app on release and try to get the location of the second assembly.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37209374/42766079-c6d7e0e4-8919-11e8-8b6f-2c24b3c7b610.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37209374/42765992-9231a852-8919-11e8-80ca-0edc7879a96f.png)


As you can see on the first picture, if we execute the program in debug mode, we can get the current path of the assembly without problems. But if we try to execute the same program in release, we only have the name of the assembly.

### Expected Behavior
Gets the current path of the aseembly

### Actual Behavior
Returns only the name of the assembly

### Version Information

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] cache java -version output" (#1938) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/Microsoft/msbuild/blob/f147a76a60bf9e516800f65f9614c914df0a4f15/src/Framework/IBuildEngine4.cs#L34-L84
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/42c07d1ae5aa56eb574b7d169499f1a9af7ec080/Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android/Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android.csproj

The new `ValidateJavaVersion` MSBuild task gets invoked for *every*
project on *every* build, regardless if there are changes or not.
Unfortunately, this task also takes around 250ms to run, since it
shells out to `java -version` and `javac -version`.

We can use MSBuild's `GetRegisteredTaskObject` and
`RegisterTaskObject` to cache the output of running these command line
tools. If we key with the full path to `java` or `javac`, the cache
should be properly invalidated if a different `JavaSdkPath` is passed
in. I added a new set of `ValidateJavaVersionTests` to directly test
this caching functionality, plus a couple smoke tests.

In the case of `Xamarin.Forms.ControlGallery.Android`:
- `ValidateJavaVersion` runs 7 times
- A build (with no changes) went from 12.820s to 11.185s, saving
  ~1.635s of build time
- I also tested the changes in VS Windows, and was able to see logs
  indicating the value is cached.

Improvements to `MockBuildEngine`:
- General code formatting / refactoring
- Added a `Messages` list that can be asserted against
- Refactored the `Task` APIs so that they are fully functional

Other changes:
- Since `BaseTest` now has a `SetUp` class, we can't have a method
  named `SetUp` or we get a warning. I used a `Setup` method (with
  lowercase u) instead, and modified `KeyToolTests` to fix this
  warning.

<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Our customer are developing a Xamarin Forms application which is running on an android scanner device. Inconsistently, customer get the issue of "no constructor found.." for random controls.

### Steps to Reproduce

Unknown, but if customer spend 2-3 hours and do lot of testing then they could get this issue.

### Expected Behavior
Not crashing

### Actual Behavior

### Something customer have tried to resolve this issue but it raised another issue

Customer read a lot of artical or documentaion about this:

1. [MonoDroid: Error when calling constructor of custom view - TwoDScrollView
](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10593022/monodroid-error-when-calling-constructor-of-custom-view-twodscrollview/10603714#10603714)
2. [MissingMethodException: No constructor found for Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Android.MapRenderer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42254083/missingmethodexception-no-constructor-found-for-xamarin-forms-maps-android-map)
3. [Random System.NotSupportedException on Android: Unable to activate instance of type Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.[VARIOUS_TYPES]](https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=40154)

So customer tried using the  work around solution of custom rendering the label class and adding the constructor as mentioned in the stack overflow url that i shared. 

```
public class MyLabelRenderer : LabelRenderer
    {
        public MyLabelRenderer(Context context) : base(context)
        {
        }

        public MyLabelRenderer(IntPtr handle, JniHandleOwnership transfer)
        {
        }

    }
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "XF - Android - TabbedPage Toolbar only shows the active ToolbarItem when ToolbarPlacement is bottom and ContentPage count bigger than 4" (#3312) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
There is a new feature in Xamarin.Forms 3.1 version which we already support for Android toolbar to be placed in the bottom. But currently after testing I found there is a bug, when the content page within the Tabbed Page is bigger than 4, then the Toolbar will now show all the tabs there, only the current active tab will be showed.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a XF project and make sure the XF version is over 3.1. (My testing is 3.1.0.637273)
2. Write the code as below in the MainPage.xaml file:

  ``` XML

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<TabbedPage xmlns="http://xamarin.com/schemas/2014/forms"
             xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2009/xaml"
             xmlns:local="clr-namespace:AllenTestTabbedPageButtom"
             xmlns:android="clr-namespace:Xamarin.Forms.PlatformConfiguration.AndroidSpecific;assembly=Xamarin.Forms.Core"
             android:TabbedPage.ToolbarPlacement="Bottom"
             x:Class="AllenTestTabbedPageButtom.MainPage">

    <local:ContentPage1 Title="1">
        
    </local:ContentPage1>

    <local:ContentPage2 Title="2">
        
    </local:ContentPage2>
    
    <ContentPage Title="3">
        
    </ContentPage>

    <ContentPage Title="4">
        
    </ContentPage>

    <ContentPage Title="5">

    </ContentPage>

</TabbedPage>

  ```

3. Run the application

### Expected Behavior
There should be five tabs in the toolbar which name 1,2,3,4,5.

### Actual Behavior
Only the active tab will be shown and the other ones can be only switched and then the tab will be selected accordingly.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: XF 3.1.0.637273
- Last known good version: NA
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - Android: Android 8.1
- Android Support Library Version: 27.0.2.1
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots
When we at the first page which title is 1:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36911474/42751278-d50c1a38-891c-11e8-978d-40b8c5518e11.png)

Then we switch to Tab 2:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36911474/42751318-f7da2c8a-891c-11e8-9133-45d4f2b31110.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can not tap on ui element" (#2771) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I detected very strange behavior on Xamarin UI test. The issue is - framework can not tap on some marked elements. This absolutely random problem. Issue may appear on Physical Device or Simulator, Android or iOS, old or new OS Systems.
### Steps to Reproduce

Any Element, in any moment when you try to tap him can be not react. The second Tap can help.

### Expected Behavior
Tap on marked Element, then Open new View.
### Actual Behavior
Tap not worked like on logs.
### Basic Information

- IDE: Visual Studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks : Xamarin.Forms 2.4.0
- Nunit : 3.1
- Xamarin UI test : 2.2.4
- Affected Devices: Samsung A310F (physical).
- Android target Sdk Version : 19

### Logs

```
[5/18/2018 12:57:16 PM Informational] ------ Run test started ------

[5/18/2018 12:57:56 PM Informational] Waiting for element matching Marked("IDTransHistory").
[5/18/2018 12:58:03 PM Informational] Using element matching Marked("IDTransHistory").
[5/18/2018 12:58:04 PM Informational] Tapping coordinates [ 532, 1114 ].
[5/18/2018 12:58:05 PM Informational] Waiting for element matching Marked("Filter").
[5/18/2018 12:58:08 PM Informational] Using element matching Marked("Filter").
[5/18/2018 12:58:08 PM Informational] Tapping coordinates [ 684, 96 ].
[5/18/2018 12:58:24 PM Informational] Error while performing Tap(Marked("Date.Start"))
Exception: System.Exception: Unable to find element. Query for Marked("Date.Start") gave no results.
   at Xamarin.UITest.SharedApp.FirstWithLog[T](T[] results, ITokenContainer tokenContainer)
   at Xamarin.UITest.Android.AndroidApp.<Tap>c__AnonStoreyB.<>m__0()
   at Xamarin.UITest.Utils.ErrorReporting.With(Action func, Object[] args, String memberName)
[5/18/2018 12:58:24 PM Informational] Waiting for element matching Marked("Filter").
[5/18/2018 12:58:28 PM Informational] Using element matching Marked("Filter").
[5/18/2018 12:58:28 PM Informational] Tapping coordinates [ 684, 96 ].
[5/18/2018 12:58:32 PM Informational] Using element matching Marked("Date.Start").
[5/18/2018 12:58:32 PM Informational] Tapping coordinates [ 71, 298 ].
[5/18/2018 12:58:35 PM Informational] Using element matching Text("2018").
[5/18/2018 12:58:35 PM Informational] Tapping coordinates [ 139, 228 ].
==========

```
Ok, as you can see the element marked Filter was using -> Tapping coordinates [ 684, 96 ]. That's mean that element is exist on monitor. But first time this not worked. Test on Single Device may be failed today and passed tomorrow. Perfectly floating error.
### Scenario Code

```
app.WaitForElement(x => x.Marked("IDTransHistory"));
app.Tap(x => x.Marked("IDTransHistory"));
try
        {
            app.WaitForElement(x => x.Marked("Filter"));
            app.Tap(x => x.Marked("Filter"));
        }
        catch (Exception)
        {
            try
            {
                app.Tap(x => x.Marked("Button.Home"));
                app.Tap(x => x.Marked("IDTransHistory"));
            }
            catch (Exception)
            {
                try
                {
                    app.Tap(x => x.Marked("Button.Home"));
                    app.Tap(x => x.Marked("IDTransHistory"));
                }
                catch (Exception)
                {
                    app.Tap(x => x.Marked("Button.Home"));
                    app.Tap(x => x.Marked("IDTransHistory"));
                }
            }
        }
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Custom view rendering issue while converting view from Xamarin Forms to native Xamarin.Android #1967" (#2882) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

Since we are not able to reopen our previous issue report https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1967,  we have created this new issue report.

## Description
Adding a custom view to the UI doesn’t occupy the entire space (loaded a grid containing 3 labels Subject, Notes, Location within a frame). A frame is set with Padding property and Grid is loaded into Frame such that the grid inside the frame doesn’t occupy the space accordingly.

Actual issue is while converting the custom view from Xamarin forms to native android. That is, in our case we are rendering the view alone (virtually) in Xamarin forms through mapping and layouting for the custom view and parenting its children are done in native Xamarin.Android.So when it comes to Xamarin forms, parenting its children in source level is not possible ,only by setting height and width to custom view in sample level fixed the issue. Thus we have attached the sample for the mentioned issue in our earlier updates.


We have converted the custom view from Xamarin forms to native referring the below conversion.

http://michaelridland.com/xamarin/creating-native-view-xamarin-forms-viewpage/

We suspect that this is a framework issue with the Grid and positioning of the elements within a Grid. Since we tried with the same layouts directly in xamarin forms and Grid occupied the entire UI in that.UI is rendered as expected Kindly find the sample along with the screenshot for this

**Sample:**

[CustomRenderer.zip
](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1750631/CustomRenderer.zip)

**Screenshot :**
![36579997-3ec78d2e-188c-11e8-9678-6c8477ee6cc7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39787321/40778562-327ed4dc-64ef-11e8-9888-6aecab38db24.jpg)

**Steps to Reproduce**
Deploy the attached sample, in the view, a grid will be loaded in the frame according to the labels added to it.

**Expected Behavior**
Grid with labels to occupy entire Frame.

**Actual Behavior**
Grid occupies the space in the Frame according to the width and height of the labels.

Only when width request or height request is set to grid or each of the children inside the grid, expected behaviour is obtained.

**Basic Information**
Version with issue: Xamarin 2.4.0
Platform Target Frameworks:
Android: 7.1
The issue is reproduced only in Xamarin.Forms Android platform.

**Sample**

[CustomControl.zip
](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1750628/CustomControl.zip)

Could you please check with the above details and provide us with a possible solution for this.

**Note**: We have checked with the latest Xamarin Forms version 3.0 and issue exists in this version also.

Closed issue "Entry and Picker Shrinked in TableView" (#2906) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
The Picker and Entry are cut off when I stack them with a label in a view cell. I used the Grid and StackLayout to stack them as I could but the edges of the Entry and the Picker still cutoff as shown on the screenshot. This happens exactly when I set the margins of the controls (Any margin be it top, bottom, left... result in the right edge of the picker or the entry to be cutoff). 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a table view and a table section in it
2. Add a view cell to this section, and place a container which can contain the picker or the Entry with the label in it.
3. Stack the controls (Label and (Picker or Entry) horizontally
4. Set a margin property to the container
5. Run on __UWP__
### Expected Behavior
The label should stack horizontally perfectly with the picker or the Entry as it does normally.

### Actual Behavior
 the picker or textview are cut off at the edge on any screen size.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0.482510
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VisualStudio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- UWP -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  16299 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0.482510
- Affected Devices: UWP

### Screenshots

![xfissue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16731017/40874491-e5786494-6667-11e8-907e-744d3421ab88.PNG)


### Reproduction Link

`<TableSection>`
                        `<ViewCell>`
                            `<StackLayout Orientation="Horizontal"`
                                        ` Margin="5">`
                                `<Label Text="Result"/>`
                                `<Entry />`
                            `</StackLayout>`
                        `</ViewCell>`
                    `</TableSection>`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Invalid cast in Xamarin.Forms/Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android/Renderers/NavigationRenderer.cs" (#3057) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm inheriting from NavigationRenderer class for my Android project and overriding this method: protected override void OnElementChanged(ElementChangedEventArgs<NavigationPage> e)

When I call "base.OnElementChanged(e);" it throws an "invalid cast" exception in line 227 of NavigationRenderer.cs. Line 227 is this:

((Platform)Element.Platform).NavAnimationInProgress = true;


When I put a breakpoint there and add the below to the Watch window during runtime:

((Platform)Element.Platform).NavAnimationInProgress

then the result is "Invalid cast".


However when I change it to this the Watch window:

((Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.AppCompat.Platform)Element.Platform)

then it returns a valid value (true or false), as the author of NavigationRenderer.cs intended for the cast to work.


So this exception seems to be caused by an ambiguous definition of the Platform class.

The problem can be resolved by specifying the full name (including the prefixes) where the cast is performed on line 227. There are other similar locations where this cast is performed, those locations should be updated as well.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "iOS: How to get stack trace line numbers in runtime?" (#2718) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm catching exceptions thrown from my code but still want to investigate them so I save them to a log file.
I have a TestFlight user who gets these exceptions that I can't repeat.
Now the log file has all the method names but no line numbers.

From a forum thread I learned that I need to include all debug info on the Compiler page and also not use the LLVM compiler. Regret that is not enough.

Looking at the project file I can see that the debug configuration also has  this line: `<MtouchDebug>True</MtouchDebug>`
When I copy it to the release config the line numbers do appear however can I upload a build like that to iTunesConnect? What are the official steps to get the line numbers in runtime?

Please advise.

Opened issue "simulatedTabBarMetrics disappears from storyboard file" (#4446) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The storyboard visual designer appears to toss away the following line from the default ViewController definitions:

<simulatedTabBarMetrics key="simulatedBottomBarMetrics"/>

after some edits that I don't believe have anything to do with the simulated tab bar. The result is the tab bar in the ViewController for the tab disappears, and it becomes impossible to set the text or icon associated with the affected tab...until you manually edit the Main.storyboard file and add the deleted line back in.

### Steps to Reproduce

1.  Create a tabbed template project in VS2017 under Windows
2.  Add a new ViewController to Main.storyboard
3.  May involve other steps -- all I know is that the problem suddenly manifested itself

### Expected Behavior

Simulated tab bar item should appear on the tab's ViewController, and the Bar Item section in Properties should appear, and be available for editing

### Actual Behavior

The tab bar item disapears, and the Bar Item section in Properties disappears, making it impossible to edit the text or icon associated with the affected ViewController
